intro: Listera makinoana, commonly known as Makino's basketweed, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its botanical features include a short stem, hairy foliage, and a unique reproductive system involving self-fertilization. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
